questions.text: When Hades released the Titans from underground to destroy Mount Olympus, which one did he send to destroy Hercules?
questions.explanation:
Cyclops.

	Without the interference of Hercules, Hades released the Titans from their prison underground. He sent the Titans to destroy Mount Olympus. Hades sent four of the Titans to destroy Zeus and Mount Olympus while he sent the cyclops to kill Hercules. Meg was injured while saving Hercules and this action gave Hercules his strength back that Hades had taken from him.

questions.text: Hercules fell in love with a woman who was working for Hades to take down Hercules. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Meg.

	Hercules met Meg when he saved her from a river guardian. He didn't know that Meg was working for Hades and Hades was using her to destroy Hercules. Meg sold her soul to Hades to save her boyfriend who then dumped her. Hercules got Meg's soul back for her and told Zeus he would rather stay with Meg than live on Mount Olympus.

questions.text: Zeus sent Hercules to a trainer named Philoctetes to train for becoming a hero. Who voiced Phil?
questions.explanation:
Danny Devito.

	Hercules wanted to return to his god status, but he needed to be trained as a hero so Zeus sent him to Phil. When Hercules first met Phil, they were both watching women bathe. Phil had retired due to the loss of the heroes he had trained. Hercules persuaded Phil to train him and make him a hero.

questions.text: What did Hercules do to regain his status as a god on Mount Olympus?
options: Hercules protected Thebes without his strength.
Hercules died to save a citizen of Thebes.
questions.explanation:
Hercules saved Meg's life.

	Hercules traded his life for Meg's life. Moments before he was going to die, Hercules was restored to a god. Hades went crazy when he realized Hercules was alive.

questions.text: Hades had two minions that didn't serve him as well as he would have liked. Pain was the name of one minion. What was the name of the other?
questions.explanation:
Panic.

	Pain and Panic were sent to kidnap baby Hercules. They changed into children so that Hercules would save them and release a monster in the process. Hades sent them to trap Pegasus so Hades could get to Hercules.

questions.text: The Muses took over the narration of the movie from what actor?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	Charlton Heston narrated the beginning of the movie moments before the five Muses took over and sang the rest of the narration. He can be heard on the soundtrack beginning the movie.

James Woods.

	James Woods enjoyed voicing Hades so much that he told Disney he would voice Hades in any other Disney movie. James offered to refund his salary when the movie went over budget because he liked voicing the character so much.

questions.text: How did Hades intend on making Hercules a mortal man?
options: Hercules would fall in love with a mortal.
questions.explanation:
Hercules would drink a potion.

	Hades' minions kidnapped baby Hercules and gave him a bottle of potion to drink. The bottle was broken before Hercules could finish the last drop of potion. He lost his god status, but kept his strength.

questions.text: What did the Fates relay to Hades about baby Hercules?
options: No one would ever know Hercules existed.
Hercules would be king of Mount Olympus.
Hercules would fall at Hades' feet.
questions.explanation:
Hercules would destroy Hades.

	Hades went to the Fates to find out how much trouble Hercules would be for him. When the Fates told Hades that Hercules would destroy him, Hades came up with a plan to get rid of Hercules.

questions.text: What gift did Zeus give his infant son when they were on Mount Olympus?
questions.explanation:
Horse.

	Zeus gave his infant son Hercules a horse named Pegasus as a gift. Shortly thereafter, Hercules was kidnapped by Hades' minions and adopted by a mortal couple.
